intro: Centrosis corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered centrose, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
